Pre-Game Insights: Philadelphia’s Tyrese Maxey tallied a game-high four steals against the Warriors and ranks second in the NBA in steals per game (2.2).

Maxey is the first 76er since Hall of Famer Allen Iverson (Nov. 18-Dec. 3, 2006) and the fourth 76er to average at least 25 points, five assists, and three steals over a six-game span. Only Maxey, Iverson, Charles Barkley, and Julius Erving have done so.
The all-time series between the 76ers and Nets favors the Sixers, 126-90, including a 113-98 Sixers’ win in Philadelphia on Nov. 22. The two teams will meet twice more in February.
Saturday will mark just the 15th home game of the season for the Nets, while the Sixers will still have played the fewest home contests in the NBA (14, tied with UTA).
Brooklyn enters their three-game homestand with four consecutive home losses.
Post-Match Reflections: 76er Paul George on if the loss to the Warriors is just a throwaway or has takeaways: 'Both, you know, you have some of these games where you just come out flat. But definitely learned the pace that they played at, and player movement, ball movement, 40-something assists. That’s great basketball.'
Others: The Sixers’ injury report against the Nets includes Joel Embiid (left foot sprain / right sinus fracture - mask) as questionable and Kelly Oubre Jr. (left hand sprain) as doubtful, while KJ Martin (left foot stress reaction) and Jared McCain (left knee meniscus surgery) remain out.

For the Nets, Noah Clowney (left hip contusion) and Cam Thomas (left hamstring strain) are questionable, Cam Johnson (right ankle sprain) is doubtful, and Bojan Bogdanovic (left foot injury recovery), Maxwell Lewis (left tibia fracture), De’Anthony Melton (left knee ACL tear), and Trendon Watford (left hamstring strain) are out.
Saturday’s game is a 6 p.m. ET start in Brooklyn.
Listen: 97.5 The Fanatic via the 76ers Mobile App
The Sixers are scheduled to wear their white Association Edition uniforms against the Nets in their black Icon Edition uniforms.
